categories: Category:Articles with an excess of redlinks

nodes.text: Young Jedi Knights: Diversity Alliance is a Star Wars Legends young-adult novel written by Kevin J. Anderson and Rebecca Moesta. It is the eighth volume of the Star Wars: Young Jedi Knights series, and it was first published by Berkley Boulevard on April 1, 1997. The novel was reprinted in Young Jedi Knights: The Fall of the Diversity Alliance (1998).

Everyone is searching for Bornan Thul. Not only is he father to one of Jacen's and Jaina's fellow students, he holds the key to a secret coalition gaining power in the New Republic. The young Jedi Knights race across the galaxy to find him—but they may be too late. For their true enemy is about to show its treacherous face. And it will be shockingly familiar…

In 2005, Boba Fett's appearances in Star Wars: Young Jedi Knights were retconned to be those of Ailyn Vel, Fett's daughter who masqueraded as him. The retcon was first established the Star Wars Insider 80 article "The History of the Mandalorians," by Abel G. Peña, and it came in part from a line in Young Jedi Knights: Diversity Alliance, in which the character Nolaa Tarkona suggests that Fett could be female.
